snippet: The city and state remain far apart on how to divide the cost of a $29 billion proposal to maintain and improve the authority’s vast system.
abstract: New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo derides suggestion from New York City officials that city may increase its contribution to Metropolitan Transportation Authority $29 billion funding plan by only $1 billion, saying city should pay full $3.2 billion requested by authority; city and state have sparred over how much city should contribute to state-controlled agency.

byline.original: By EMMA G. FITZSIMMONS and MICHAEL M. GRYNBAUM

lead_paragraph: The city and state remain far apart on how to divide the cost of a $29 billion proposal to maintain and improve the authority’s vast system.

headline.main: Cuomo Says Deal Over M.T.A. Capital Plan Is Not Near
headline.print_headline: Cuomo Says Deal to Split M.T.A. Cost Is Not Near
